org.jerkar.api.depmanagement

Class JkDepExclude

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jerkar.api.depmanagement.JkDepExclude
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public final class JkDepExclude
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Information about excluding artifacts or whole modules.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public static JkDepExclude of(JkModuleId moduleId)
        Creates an exclusion of the specified module.

      • of

        Creates an exclusion of the specified module.

      • of

        public static JkDepExclude of(java.lang.String groupAndName)
        Creates an exclusion of the specified module.

      • type

        public JkDepExclude type(java.lang.String typeArg)
        Returns an exclusion identical to this one but with the specified type. Types generally corresponds to extension or classifier but not always. Some examples are jar, test-jar, test-client.

      • ext

        public JkDepExclude ext(java.lang.String extension)
        Returns an exclusion identical to this one but with the specified extension. Types generally corresponds to extension or classifier but not always. Some examples are jar, test-jar, test-client.

      • scopes

        public JkDepExclude scopes(JkScope... scopes)
        Returns a exclusion identical to this one but narrowed to the specified scopes. When some scopes are defined, the exclusion is effective only if the dependency likely to hold the module to exclude is declared with one of the specified scopes.

      • moduleId

        public JkModuleId moduleId()
        Returns the module id to exclude.

      • type

        public java.lang.String type()
        Returns the type of the artifact file to exclude.
        See Also:
        type(String)

      • ext

        public java.lang.String ext()
        Returns the extension for the artifact files to exclude. If not null only file artifact having this extension will be effectively excluded.

      • getScopes

        public java.util.Set<JkScope> getScopes()
        Returns the scopes that render the exclusion effective.
        See Also:
        scopes(JkScope...)
